metadata.title: CVE-2024-28182 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description: nghttp2 is an implementation of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol version 2in C. The nghttp2 library prior to version 1.61.0 keeps reading theunbounded number of HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames even after a stream is resetto keep HPACK context in sync.  This causes excessive CPU usage to decodeHPACK stream. nghttp2 v1.61.0 mitigates this vulnerability by limiting thenumber of CONTINUATION frames it accepts per stream. There is no workaroundfor this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: nghttp2 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
